Uses of Package
org.hl7.vmr.r2

  • Packages that use org.hl7.vmr.r2 
    Package Description
    org.hl7.cdsinput.r2  
    org.hl7.cdsinputspecification.r2  
    org.hl7.cdsoutput.r2  
    org.hl7.cdsoutputspecification.r2  
    org.hl7.vmr.r2  
  • Classes in org.hl7.vmr.r2 used by org.hl7.cdsinput.r2 
    Class and Description
    CodedIdentifier
    An II with an additional code to represent the associated concept.
    NameValuePair
    Class that represents a generic Name-Value-Pair object where the name is generally a token (a string without spaces), a semantic category that is controlled by a terminology and a value which may be any type deriving from ANY and/or defined by a template.
    Organization
    An Entity representing a formalized group of persons or other organizations with a common purpose and the infrastructure to carry out that purpose.
    Person
    A human being.
    VMR
    A virtual medical record (vMR) contains data about a patient relevant for CDS, either with regard to the data used for generating inferences (input) or the conclusions reached as a result of analyzing the data (output).
  • Classes in org.hl7.vmr.r2 used by org.hl7.cdsinputspecification.r2 
    Class and Description
    CodedIdentifier
    An II with an additional code to represent the associated concept.
  • Classes in org.hl7.vmr.r2 used by org.hl7.cdsoutput.r2 
    Class and Description
    CodedIdentifier
    An II with an additional code to represent the associated concept.
    StringNameValuePair
    Class that represents a generic StringName-StringValue-Pair object where the name is just an ST and the value is also an ST and defined by a template.
    Value
    Class that represents a generic value which may be of any type deriving from ANY.
    VMR
    A virtual medical record (vMR) contains data about a patient relevant for CDS, either with regard to the data used for generating inferences (input) or the conclusions reached as a result of analyzing the data (output).
  • Classes in org.hl7.vmr.r2 used by org.hl7.cdsoutputspecification.r2 
    Class and Description
    CodedIdentifier
    An II with an additional code to represent the associated concept.
  • Classes in org.hl7.vmr.r2 used by org.hl7.vmr.r2 
    Class and Description
    AbstractCondition
    An assertion regarding a clinical condition of the subject that needs to be treated or managed.
    AbstractDeniedCondition
    A denial of the existence of a condition, problem, or allergy.
    AdministrableSubstance
    A material, generally but not exclusively a medication or antigen, of a particular constitution that can be given to a person to enable a clinical effect.
    AdverseEvent
    Unfavorable healthcare event (e.g., death, rash, difficulty breathing, a fall, or an adverse surgical event) that may or may not have been caused by some agent (e.g., a medication, immunization, food, or environmental agent).
    AdverseEventBase
    Abstract base class for both adverse events and denied adverse events.
    AllergyOrIntolerance
    An allergy or intolerance triggered by a known or suspected agent.
    AnchoredEvent
    Identifies the timing of a point-in-time occurrence and optionally a sub-cycle in a cycle that starts at a specific point in the cycle and may span a duration of time.
    AppointmentProposal
    Proposal, e.g., by a CDS system, for an Encounter to take place.
    AppointmentRequest
    A request by a provider to schedule an appointment.
    BodySite
    A location on an EvaluatedPerson's body.
    ClinicalStatement
    A record of something of clinical relevance that is being done, has been done, can be done, or is intended or requested to be done.
    CodedIdentifier
    An II with an additional code to represent the associated concept.
    CodedRecurringEvent
    Specification of a repetitive schedule element as a code.
    CommunicationBase
    A communication is a message sent between a sender and a recipient for a purpose and about a topic.
    CommunicationEvent
    A communication event that is occurring or has occurred.
    CommunicationOrder
    An order to communicate.
    CommunicationProposal
    A proposal to communicate.
    CompositeObservationResult
    The findings from an observation represented as a composition of child observation results.
    CompositeSubstanceOrder
    A class representing an order for a composite medication such as IV fluid that may consist of one or more additives mixed into a diluent.
    CompositeSubstanceProposal
    A class representing a proposal for a composite medication such as IV fluid that may consist of one or more additives mixed into a diluent.
    ConditionBase
    Abstract base class for problems, which are clinical conditions that need to be treated or managed.
    Constituent
    A component of a multi-component substance administration.
    Cycle
    Represents a predictable periodic interval where events may occur at specific points within this interval.
    CycleEventTiming
    Identifies a repeating pattern to the intended time periods such as the number of occurrences in a given time period, the days in a multi-day cycle, or a code representing the frequency of occurrence for a given cycle.
    DeniedAdverseEvent
    A denial that the subject has or had the specified adverse event.
    DeniedAllergyOrIntolerance
    An statement denying the presence of an allergy or intolerance to a specific agent.
    DeniedProblem
    An statement denying the presence of a clinical condition.
    Device
    This resource identifies an instance of a manufactured thing that is used in the provision of healthcare without being substantially changed through that activity.
    Documentation
    This type may be used to represent documentation that is either free text or richer in format (e.g., XML or HTML) where provenance is not relevant.
    Dose
    How the medication is to be used by or administered to the patient.
    DoseRestriction
    Referred to in CDA release 2 as maxDoseQuantity.
    EncounterBase
    The abstract base class for an encounter of an EvaluatedPerson with the healthcare system.
    EncounterEvent
    EncounterEvent is the record of an interaction between an EvaluatedPerson and the healthcare system.
    EnteralFeedingDispenseOrder
    A clinical order for dispensing an enteral feeding product.
    EnteralFeedingDispenseProposal
    A clinical proposal for dispensing an enteral feeding product.
    EnteralFeedingOrder
    A class representing enteral nutrition orders for the delivery of enteral-fed substances (eg, Nutren, Ensure, RenalCal) for patients who are unable to consume diets orally; enteral feedings can be delivered to the stomach or varying parts of the small intestines using a variety of tube placement methods, depending on the clinical scenario.
    EnteralFeedingProposal
    A class representing enteral nutrition proposals for the delivery of enteral-fed substances (eg, Nutren, Ensure, RenalCal) for patients who are unable to consume diets orally; enteral feedings can be delivered to the stomach or varying parts of the small intestines using a variety of tube placement methods, depending on the clinical scenario.
    Entity
    A physical thing, group of physical things or an organization.
    EvaluatedPerson
    A person who is the subject of evaluation by a CDS system.
    ExtendedVmrTypeBase
    Abstract base class for extended vMR types.
    Facility
    A property such as a building that has been established to enable the performance of specific activities, typically by organizations.
    Goal
    A clinical end or aim towards which effort is directed.
    GoalBase
    Abstract base class for a goal, which is a clinical end or aim towards which effort is directed.
    GoalProposal
    Proposal, e.g., by a CDS system, for establishing the goal specified.
    GroupingClinicalStatement
    A clinical statement which serves to group other clinical statements.
    ImagingOrder
    An order to perform an Imaging study.
    ImagingProposal
    A proposal for an Imaging Order.
    LaboratoryOrder
    An order for a laboratory test.
    LaboratoryProposal
    A proposal for a laboratory test.
    LocalizationMethod
    The imaging modality and the frequency with which it will be used to confirm that a tumor/target is in the same position at the time of treatment as it was at the time of simulation are defined.
    MissedAppointment
    An appointment that was (i) scheduled, (ii) not rescheduled or canceled, and (iii) for which the EvaluatedPerson did not show up.
    MotionManagement
    Class representing a method to control the positioning and movement of a specific area of the body.
    NameValuePair
    Class that represents a generic Name-Value-Pair object where the name is generally a token (a string without spaces), a semantic category that is controlled by a terminology and a value which may be any type deriving from ANY and/or defined by a template.
    NoKnownAllergy
    Use this class to model 'No known allergies' or 'No known drug allergies', or more generally, no known allergy to a class of substances.
    NutrientModification
    Nutrient modifications allows the post-coordination of diets in cases where such post-coordination is required.
    ObservationBase
    The abstract base class for an observation which represents a result (e.g., a laboratory value), a clinical finding (e.g., sitting, tachypneic, rebound tenderness), or an inferred finding such as one produced by a CDS system (e.g., patient is in need of an HbA1c test).
    ObservationResult
    The findings from an observation.
    OralDietBase
    Concept generally representing food and/or a nutritional supplement prepared from food ingredients that is self-administered by a patient and consumed orally.
    OralDietOrder
    A class representing a wide variety of allowable types of meals and/or specification of meal and/or nutrient restrictions for an individual patient, based on the patient's clinical condition.
    OralDietProposal
    A class representing a proposal for a wide variety of allowable types of meals and/or specification of meal and/or nutrient restrictions for an individual patient, based on the patient's clinical condition.
    Organization
    An Entity representing a formalized group of persons or other organizations with a common purpose and the infrastructure to carry out that purpose.
    PCAOrder
    Order represents a Patient Controlled Analgesic.
    PCAProposal
    Order proposal represents a Patient Controlled Analgesic.
    Person
    A human being.
    Practitioner
    A person who is directly or indirectly involved in the provisioning of healthcare.
    Problem
    An assertion regarding a clinical condition of the subject that needs to be treated or managed.
    ProcedureBase
    Abstract base class for a procedure, which is a series of steps taken on a subject to accomplish a clinical goal.
    ProcedureEvent
    The actual event of performing a procedure.
    ProcedureOrder
    An order for procedure to be done.
    ProcedureProposal
    Proposals for a procedure to take place, e.g., generated by a CDS system or by a consulting clinician.
    Qualification
    Qualifications obtained by training and certification.
    RadiotherapyOrder
    An order for a radiotherapy procedure.
    RadiotherapyProposal
    A proposal for a radiotherapy procedure.
    RadiotherapySimulation
    The type of imaging and any accessories that will be used during a simulation session for radiotherapy.
    RecurringEvent
    Specifies timing as a number of times the event occurs in the cycleLength and whether the time interval is important.
    RelatedClinicalStatement
    The container for a relationship between a source and a target Clinical Statement.
    RelatedEntity
    A class that specifies the nature of the relationship between a source and target entity.
    RelatedEvaluatedPerson
    Person who has a clinical relationship to the patient and whose clinical data is relevant to that patient.
    RelationshipDescriptorBase
    The relationship between one class and another.
    RespiratoryCareOrder
    Orders that encompass supplemental oxygen (eg, nasal cannula, face mask), BiPAP/CPAP, and mechanical ventilation.
    RespiratoryCareProposal
    Order proposals that encompass supplemental oxygen (eg, nasal cannula, face mask), BiPAP/CPAP, and mechanical ventilation.
    Schedule
    A schedule that specifies an event that may occur multiple times.
    ScheduledAppointment
    A clinical appointment that has been scheduled.
    ScheduledProcedure
    A procedure that has been scheduled to take place.
    Specimen
    A sample of tissue, blood, urine, water, air, etc., taken for the purposes of diagnostic examination or evaluation.
    StringNameValuePair
    Class that represents a generic StringName-StringValue-Pair object where the name is just an ST and the value is also an ST and defined by a template.
    SubstanceAdministrationEvent
    The actual administration of the substance.
    SubstanceAdministrationOrder
    A clinical order for the administration of a substance.
    SubstanceAdministrationProposal
    Proposal for a substance administration.
    SubstanceClinicalStatementBase
    Abstract base class for giving a material of a particular constitution to a person to enable a clinical effect.
    SubstanceDispenseEvent
    This is the Event of a pharmacy filling a prescription or a record of a substance being dispensed but not administered.
    SubstanceDispenseOrder
    A clinical order for provision of a supply of a medication generally with the intention that it is subsequently consumed by a patient (usually in response to a prescription).
    SubstanceDispenseProposal
    A clinical proposal for provision of a supply of a medication generally with the intention that it is subsequently consumed by a patient (usually in response to a prescription).
    SupplyBase
    Abstract base class for the provision of some clinical material or equipment to the subject, such as a wheelchair.
    SupplyEvent
    The provision of some clinical material or equipment to the subject, such as a wheelchair.
    SupplyOrder
    A provider's order to deliver the supply.
    SupplyProposal
    Proposal, e.g., by a CDS system, for a Supply to be delivered.
    TextureModification
    TextureModification specifies or modifies the texture for one or more types of food in a diet.
    UndeliveredProcedure
    Documentation that a procedure was not delivered.
    UndeliveredSubstanceAdministration
    Documents the non-delivery of a substance.
    UndeliveredSupply
    Documentation that the indicated material was not provided to the subject.
    VaccinationProtocol
    Contains information about the protocol under which the vaccine was administered.
    Value
    Class that represents a generic value which may be of any type deriving from ANY.
    VMR
    A virtual medical record (vMR) contains data about a patient relevant for CDS, either with regard to the data used for generating inferences (input) or the conclusions reached as a result of analyzing the data (output).
